p: Among patients with respiratory disease 13 different serotypes of four enterovirus species were identified by VP4/VP2 sequence analysis including A ( n = 2, 2 serotypes), B ( n = 11, 7 serotypes), C ( n = 10, 3 serotypes), and D ( n = 8, 1 serotype). CV-A24 ( n = 8) and EV-D68 ( n = 8) were the two most common serotypes detected (Table 3) and these viruses had a close genetic relationship in phylogenetic tree analyses (Additional file 3: Figure S3).
